content.description: Predominantly a sustained vertical handcrack with your usual Mt Lemmon edges scattered about.  The start is sporty and heady.  Somewhat wide finish.  Great jamming.  Solid for the  grade.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Gear anchor.  For the descent, there is no fixed anchor.  I would not attempt this route without bringing about 20 feet of webbing or accessory cord to loop around a horizontal horn for the rappel.
content.location: This route is actually on the Militant Students pinnacle as you approach the Iranian Wall.  As you approach, look for a smooth face with a hand crack above it on the left back side of the pinnacle.

content.description: From Steiger: This pitch climbs the attractive right-facing open book on the left side of the west face. 2) Ascend the 2nd pitch of Persian Diversions. Include a full set of Friends.
content.location: open book on left side of west face.

content.description: Actually a west facing and south facing wall on the most left side of a long expanse of cliffs seen north of Windy Ridge across Willow Canyon.  There is a good picture of the landmark features east of the Iranian Wall in the Kerry guidebook.  The climbing is predominantly trad here.  Plan to build gear anchors and walk off.  I wouldn't expect company.  The south face features a series of left facing corners.  You drop down and around a large fractured column to reach the west face.  There are several other notable walls/formations in this area.
